thread.title: Hop meeting set Friday in Temple
thread.title_full: Hop meeting set Friday in Temple

author: STAFF REPORT
title: Hop meeting set Friday in Temple
text:
A public meeting on the Hop’s new micro-transit system will be held from 4:45 to 6:45 p.m. on Friday.
The meeting, led by the Hill Country Transit District, will be at the Temple Public Library, 100 W. Adams Ave. in downtown Temple.

Isolated thunderstorms early, then mainly cloudy overnight with thunderstorms likely. Gusty winds and small hail are possible. Low near 65F. Winds SE at 10 to 20 mph. Chance of rain 80%..
Isolated thunderstorms early, then mainly cloudy overnight with thunderstorms likely. Gusty winds and small hail are possible. Low near 65F. Winds SE at 10 to 20 mph. Chance of rain 80%.
Updated: March 14, 2024 @ 5:13 pm
A public meeting on the Hop’s new micro-transit system will be held from 4:45 to 6:45 p.m. on Friday.
The meeting, led by the Hill Country Transit District, will be at the Temple Public Library, 100 W. Adams Ave. in downtown Temple.
The service, which will replaced the agency’s fixed routes, will resemble a shared-ride service such as Uber or Lyft but will still only cost the current price of a ride on one of the fixed-route service buses: $1.
For people who rely on the bus for transportation, the new service is expected to reduce wait times and increase the satisfaction from the rider, officials said.
The transit district will gather public comments on the new system, expected to be implemented this May.
“These zones are expected to revolutionize transportation accessibility for Temple residents,” a news release said. “However, it’s imperative that the community’s voice is heard and considered in this decision-making process.”
The changes will affect complementary paratransit service, available through the Americans with Disabilities Act.
“It’s crucial that individuals who rely on these services have the opportunity to provide feedback and express any concerns they may have,” the release said. “It’s worth noting that Medicaid transportation services will not be affected by these changes.
A copy of the proposed options for route changes will be made available at the public hearing.
For more information, contact the district at 254-933-3700.
